snippet.textDisplay: My favorite game of all time. I have plenty of fond memories playing it and getting lost in its world. The soundtrack is amazing. I remember that, at the time of me playing it, the OST really reminded me of Golden Sun's. Lo and behold, it was by the same composer haha.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite game of all time. I have plenty of fond memories playing it and getting lost in its world. The soundtrack is amazing. I remember that, at the time of me playing it, the OST really reminded me of Golden Sun's. Lo and behold, it was by the same composer haha.

snippet.textDisplay: I've got to ask, time and time again, just what is the point in Japanese culture which always has some of the best JRPGs ending up with the main character holding dual weapons. From .//hack to Tales of Symphonia to La Pucelle to Suikoden to Grandia... just what is it that makes holding 2 of the same better than both ever could be on their own...?
snippet.textOriginal: I've got to ask, time and time again, just what is the point in Japanese culture which always has some of the best JRPGs ending up with the main character holding dual weapons. From .//hack to Tales of Symphonia to La Pucelle to Suikoden to Grandia... just what is it that makes holding 2 of the same better than both ever could be on their own...?

snippet.textDisplay: This song brings out an emotion nothing else does for me. Its sad. Nostalgic. Almost hopefull. While being short and sweat. This kind of music is not made any more for tales games. Nothing I've heard from berseria is even close to how wonderful this is. Any good game can be an even better one with a splendid soundtrack, I've felt no passion or soul put into any modern tales games. And that's a shame.

snippet.textDisplay: i love this music.  I used to have this awesome couch in my gaming room....and sometimes i would just load the game up, get to the desert town, and just take a nap with it on....that was my sleeping couch.  I know it sounds like something old to say, but i was just out of college at the time, and ive never been someone who could take naps....weird memory.

snippet.textDisplay:
I recently finished the game and it was GREAT! The overall story wasn't that important and the drama could be more intense, especially there was enough materials, some were very intense like the Desians, but the mysteries behind the characters, their schemes and all about the world, kept me curious to proceed the story more eagerly.
Kratos Aurion is my favorite character, by far! ^^

I no play the sequel and despite the lack of an overworld, the game is pretty good, especially the combat is much more fun and challenging.

Kratos Aurion is my favorite character, by far! ^^

I no play the sequel and despite the lack of an overworld, the game is pretty good, especially the combat is much more fun and challenging.

snippet.textDisplay: I Agree mostly. Tales of the Abyss was my personal all time favorite, with Symphonia in at a very close second. Symphonia does hold a special place for me, as it's the first Tales game I played all the way thru (was so hooked I beat it playing with every character as soon as they became playable), for a total of i think 11 or 12 times. The grade shop is the best part of the Tales games. Adds so much replayability.

snippet.textDisplay: I seriously doubt that. It's a pretty subjective matter though, so it really comes down to what your tastes are. If you want a positive, upbeat game, go with Graces. If you want a more dark and realistic experience, Abyss is probably your safest bet. All the games have SOMETHING they do better than the others, so it's really hard to say which one is "the best". In my personal opinion it's Symphonia or Abyss, but I can perfectly understand why someone would prefer Vesperia or Graces.
snippet.textOriginal: I seriously doubt that. It's a pretty subjective matter though, so it really comes down to what your tastes are. If you want a positive, upbeat game, go with Graces. If you want a more dark and realistic experience, Abyss is probably your safest bet. All the games have SOMETHING they do better than the others, so it's really hard to say which one is "the best". In my personal opinion it's Symphonia or Abyss, but I can perfectly understand why someone would prefer Vesperia or Graces.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Joernboy Oh come on, it's not THAT bad, just nowhere near as good as the other "Tales of" games. 

But on closer thought, I think Dawn of the New World is better than Legendia. Plus, now I've trie Tales of Graces F as well, so here is my new list: 

8. Tales of Hearts
7. Tales of Legendia
6. Tales of Symphonia: Dawn of the New World
5. Tales of Phantasia
4. Tales of Vesperia
3. Tales of Graces F
2. Tales of the Abyss
1. Tales of Symphonia
snippet.textOriginal:
@Joernboy Oh come on, it's not THAT bad, just nowhere near as good as the other "Tales of" games. 

But on closer thought, I think Dawn of the New World is better than Legendia. Plus, now I've trie Tales of Graces F as well, so here is my new list: 

8. Tales of Hearts
7. Tales of Legendia
6. Tales of Symphonia: Dawn of the New World
5. Tales of Phantasia
4. Tales of Vesperia
3. Tales of Graces F
2. Tales of the Abyss
1. Tales of Symphonia

snippet.textDisplay:
Yeah, any of those would work, really. Even just grass would work if it was of the same style and integrated better...just a little boring. It's just such a hack job, poorly executed. 

Your idea of Tehe'alla and Sylvarant in the background would give the characters an environment that's specific and fits them well. Maybe you should remake the cover, it could only be an improvement,lol!
snippet.textOriginal:
Yeah, any of those would work, really. Even just grass would work if it was of the same style and integrated better...just a little boring. It's just such a hack job, poorly executed. 

Your idea of Tehe'alla and Sylvarant in the background would give the characters an environment that's specific and fits them well. Maybe you should remake the cover, it could only be an improvement,lol!

snippet.textDisplay: Yes, the individual drawings are good (I believe they are either conceptual designs or early game promotion) but the designer simply clipped the art out, feathered the edge then dropped them into a PHOTO of grass and used and bland font and generic drop shadow for the title and called it a day. I would say it's lazy but if you were REALLY lazy, you would use the logo on the box (which is not bad) and slap it on some sketches that look artsy and be done, that would look far better than this crap.
snippet.textOriginal: Yes, the individual drawings are good (I believe they are either conceptual designs or early game promotion) but the designer simply clipped the art out, feathered the edge then dropped them into a PHOTO of grass and used and bland font and generic drop shadow for the title and called it a day. I would say it's lazy but if you were REALLY lazy, you would use the logo on the box (which is not bad) and slap it on some sketches that look artsy and be done, that would look far better than this crap.

snippet.textDisplay: The first time i played ToS it changed the way I view RPG's forever. Now I've played through it more times than I care to remember, and every time it strikes me what a truly outstanding game it is in all respects: the music, gameplay, characters, story, art style - everything. It has won a place in heart that will never be taken, and has so many amazing soundtracks they could frankly all be in this list. Quite remarkable.
snippet.textOriginal: The first time i played ToS it changed the way I view RPG's forever. Now I've played through it more times than I care to remember, and every time it strikes me what a truly outstanding game it is in all respects: the music, gameplay, characters, story, art style - everything. It has won a place in heart that will never be taken, and has so many amazing soundtracks they could frankly all be in this list. Quite remarkable.

snippet.textDisplay: Oh that's right, I remember now. Thanks :) Somehow I'm not sure this music really fits that area. I'm not saying it's not a good piece of music, but it's a bit too relaxed considering they've just entered a world they shouldn't even know about, and know nothing of. It's stilla  nice piece though.
